author: Special Correspondent
text:
The first-stage trial of Voter Verifiable Paper Audit Trail machine was conducted in Erode on Thursday.— PHOTO: M. GOVARTHAN

After completion of data deletion, the working of Voters Verifiable Paper Audit Trail (VVPAT) machines were checked on Thursday.

Experts of Bharat Electronics Limited, who deleted the data, monitored the working of VVPAT machines through a trial run of casting 1,000 votes in EVM units attached to each. District Collector S. Prabakar initiated the process in the presence of representatives of recognised political parties. A total of 386 machines are to be utilised in 285 polling booths in Erode West segment.

The Election Control Room has received 794 complaints from the public in eight Assembly constituencies in the district, as on March 15.

The complaints were addressed within a few hours, according to a press release issued by the District Collector.

Out of the total complaints, 124 pertained to erasing of wall advertisements, removing 103 wall posters, and removing 83 banners from urban areas. There were also complaints resulting in erasing of wall paintings, and removal of posters and banners from private-owned buildings, the release said.

Implementation of Election Commission’s norms were being carried out round the clock in eight-hour shifts in every Assembly segment by a flying squad, static monitoring group, and a video monitoring group.

The public could report ECI norm violations to the Election Control Room over phone: 0424 - 2267671 / 2267677 /2267680, and Toll-free number: 18004253757.
title: First-stage trial of VVPAT machines carried out in Erode
